definition: to entertain/to repay/to return/to reward/to compensate/to reply/to answer

sentences.english: Her husband, who sells used car parts, has seen his commissions drop.
sentences.chinese: 她的丈夫经销二手次车配件，他的薪酬也下降了。

sentences.english: The thesis emphasizes the materiality of the compensation allocation first.
sentences.chinese: 论文首先强调了薪酬分配的重要性。

sentences.english: Second, the pay and benefits, the realization of the merger of the existing dual pay system.
sentences.chinese: 其次在薪酬福利方面，实现现有的双薪酬体系并轨。

sentences.english: Second, the pay and benefits, the realization of the merger of the existing dual pay system.
sentences.chinese: 其次在薪酬福利方面，实现现有的双薪酬体系并轨。

sentences.english: Because the salary is based on the number of barrels of water transport to pay.
sentences.chinese: 因为它的薪酬是根据运水的桶数来支付的。

sentences.english: S. pay czar will give Benmosche leeway on pay.
sentences.chinese: 美国“薪酬沙皇”将对他网开一面。

sentences.english: Compensation is still an issue, Mr. Pasciucco indicated.
sentences.chinese: 帕西科说，薪酬仍是一个问题。

sentences.english: Post setting and salary system are the core of the reform of the personnel system.
sentences.chinese: 高校岗位设置和薪酬体系是高校人事制度改革的核心。

sentences.english: And the ticket inspectors who have low salaries .
sentences.chinese: 还有检票员，因为薪酬很低也榜上有名。

sentences.english: Salary and Reward System is the important way to support and realize general strategic target for the enter- prise.
sentences.chinese: 薪酬体系是支持和实现企业总体战略目标的重要手段。

sentences.english: The U.S. pay czar willgive Benmosche leeway on pay.
sentences.chinese: 美国“薪酬沙皇”将对他网开一面。

sentences.english: But they never increased her earnings.
sentences.chinese: 但他们从来没有给她加过薪酬。

sentences.english: The decision-making leaders are also concerned with the sky-high annual salary.
sentences.chinese: 天价薪酬也引起了决策高层的关注。

sentences.english: His lawyer wife, Michelle, had been a high-paid hospital executive.
sentences.chinese: 他的妻子米歇尔一直担任薪酬丰厚的医院院长。

sentences.english: It would be run by professional managers, not necessarily from Japan, rewarded with performance-based salaries.
sentences.chinese: 专业经理人不需要一定来自日本，薪酬由其表现决定。

sentences.english: For the first time, sales teams were paid according to their contributions to gross profit.
sentences.chinese: 销售团队的薪酬第一次跟其对毛利润的贡献挂上钩。
